title: Ultra-Orthodox and trans: 'I prayed to God to make me a girl'
description: Growing up as a Hasidic Jew, Abby Stein had no idea trans people existed - she just felt sure she was a girl.

title: Jack Ma: The billionaire trying to stop coronavirus (and fix China's reputation)
description: How Jack Ma's growing clout during the coronavirus crisis may put him in the sights of China's jealous leaders.

title: Coronavirus: Five firms booming despite the lockdown
description: Amid all the threats posed by Covid-19 pandemic, some firms are finding ways to forge ahead.

title: Coronavirus: What is a vaccine and how is one made?
description: We look at the work needed to create a vaccine and when one might be ready for the coronavirus.

title: Coronavirus: Artist Tom Croft paints NHS key worker portraits for free
description: Artist Tom Croft has introduced 500 artists to possible subjects, after an online post offering to paint the portrait of a front-line worker.

title: Charli XCX on her lockdown album: 'Why didn't I do this before?'
description: The pop star has set herself the challenge of recording a new album from scratch in six weeks.

title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: A couple inseparable in sickness and in health
description: Michael and Mary Blessington were placed apart in hospital, but started to improve once moved together.

title: Coronavirus: The father of 13 self isolating with Covid-19
description: The Hann family have found lockdown a struggle but say they feel "privileged" as they pull together.

title: Coronavirus: Can these robot roommates liven up lockdown?
description: The BBC's Cody Godwin invites some robots to entertain her - and her dog Bogart - during lockdown.

title: Coronavirus: Spain's children run free from lockdown - but not all
description: After six weeks indoors, under-14s are being let out of doors, but how damaging was the lockdown?

title: The farmers bringing their fields indoors
description: Indoor farms, where crops are grown on shelves, are supplying cities with fruit and veg.

title: Sally Rooney's novel Normal People adapted for TV
description: On location in Dublin with the stars of Normal People Paul Mescal and Daisy Edgar-Jones.

title: Moise Kean: Everton 'appalled' at 'lockdown breach' incident
description: Everton say they are "appalled" after images emerge appearing to show striker Moise Kean at a house party.

title: Coronavirus: Ecuador 'victim' found alive in hospital mix-up
description: The Ecuadorean woman was wrongly declared to be dead, and someone else's ashes were sent to her family.

title: Coronavirus: Plea for public to get medical care when they need it
description: People needing help should not be put off by the coronavirus pandemic, say health professionals.

title: Coronavirus test online slots booked up within hour of site reopening
description: Millions of key workers and people they live with can apply for a coronavirus test online.

title: Coronavirus: Cummings attended meetings of key scientific group
description: Downing Street confirms the PM's chief adviser attended Sage meetings but denies he is a member.

title: Coronavirus: Belgium unveils plans to lift lockdown
description: Schools will be allowed to reopen from 11 May, but with no more than 10 pupils per class.

title: #GoalsAtHome: Your best attempts at Didier Drogba's FA Cup screamer
description: Match of the Day's Steve Wilson commentates on your attempts to recreate Didier Drogba's stunning goal in Chelsea's 2012 FA Cup semi-final thrashing of Spurs.

title: Coronavirus: India allows small shops to reopen
description: Only half of staff are allowed to work and must take precautions such as wearing face masks.

title: Back-garden runners set for 2.6 Challenge - share your story #bbcathletics
description: The London Marathon might be postponed but runners are still getting in the miles and raising money for charity - here are some of their inspiring stories.

title: 'Elite only' London Marathon 'one of 10 options' being considered for postponed race
description: This year's postponed London Marathon could be staged with elite athletes only, says race director Hugh Brasher.

title: Regular meetings on restarting sport planned
description: Medical directors are due to meet in the coming week to discuss how sport could restart, even if only behind closed doors.

title: Norwich defend furloughing staff with up to £35m loss expected
description: Norwich City will "stick to their guns" on a decision to furlough non-playing staff and expect to lose up to £35m.

title: Coronavirus: Some states begin to reopen as US death toll passes 50,000
description: Georgia, Oklahoma and Alaska lift some restrictions despite warnings that it may be too soon.

title: The Papers: 'Pick 10 lockdown friends' and football 'back soon'
description: Suggestions for how the UK is going to start easing lockdown measures are among the front page stories.

title: Coronavirus: Doctors dismantle Trump's treatment comments
description: They warned that heeding his comments on using disinfectants or UV light could have fatal consequences.
